title: Calories in Canned Pumpkin
meta_description: Discover calories in canned pumpkin per cup, including carbs, fiber, protein, and full nutrition breakdown for easy meal planning.
assumptions: Plain, unsweetened, unsalted canned pumpkin puree; 1 cup = 245 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, added ingredients, and processing; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of plain canned pumpkin provides about 83 kcal and 7 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: With added sugar (1 tbsp per cup)
With added salt (1/4 tsp per cup)
Mixed with 1 tbsp butter per cup

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of canned pumpkin?
faqs.a: About 83 kcal for plain, unsweetened canned pumpkin.

faqs.q: Is canned pumpkin low in calories?
faqs.a: Yes, 83 kcal per cup, mostly from carbs with high fiber content.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in canned pumpkin?
faqs.a: Around 20 g carbs per cup, including 7.1 g fiber and 8.1 g sugars.

faqs.q: Does canned pumpkin have fat or cholesterol?
faqs.a: Very low fat (0.7 g per cup) and 0 mg cholesterol.

faqs.q: How does canned compare to fresh pumpkin calories?
faqs.a: Similar; canned is about 34 kcal per 100 g, like cooked fresh.
